main_definition: a conjunction used to introduce a result or consequence, often indicating that something is done to such an extent.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to such an extent; so much; therefore
meanings_and_examples.example: I was so tired that I fell asleep during the movie.

meanings_and_examples.definition: as far or to what degree something is, it can be used in comparisons
meanings_and_examples.example: She runs so fast, she could beat any athlete in her age group.

meanings_and_examples.definition: in a particular way; according to the manner described by a preceding statement
meanings_and_examples.example: I am going home so quietly that no one will hear me.

meanings_and_examples.definition: to such an extent or degree as regards something, used in comparisons
meanings_and_examples.example: The weather was so hot today that it felt like we were in a desert.
He left the room so abruptly that everyone was surprised.
